places_with_reviews.name: Bhawarnath Temple
places_with_reviews.address: 35Q9+MF2, Sikandarpur Rd, Azamgarh, Uttar Pradesh 276001, India

reviews.text:
go with devotion, u will find peace of mind.

visit after 8 pm, participate in prabhu shringar done almost everyday, stay there for atleast an hour,
u will feel relaxed, free from dilemma and the spiritual energy will.help u a lot in your life problems.

One of the Famous temple/ place in azamgarh.
Nice place to spend time, surrounded by Greeneries.

Have a parking facility available as well.

Good for marriage and other small programs.

Yes! It's very rush at festival times.
They have rooms available as well if you are planning for some marriage or for marriage dates.

This is a very old and famous Shiva temple of Azamgarh district. The nearby intersection is named after Baba Bhawan Nath as Bhawan Nath Square. Buses for Gorakhpur and Ayodhya are available from here. There are many fruit and vegetable shops nearby during Shivratri. There is a lot of crowd, the roads are diverted. हर हर महादेव🔱
Temple inside is very good the outer area specifically the parking and the near shops make its very dirty

One of the main Bhagwan Shiva temple in azamgarh, it is suitated outskirts of main city. Other god and goddess idols are also there and a Tulsi plant. It has lot of space with two gates entrance/exit. In this temple one can pray and other part of temple small marriage functions and Jagrata can be done. During festive season many small shops are there and it is very crowdy outside also

places_with_reviews.name: Bhawarnath Chauraha

reviews.text: Overall Great Experience ❣️ especially when uh visit in the month of sawan❣️ as a devotee of bholenath, the peace I found there is unbelievable. Bhawarnath temple Is such great place to opt positive energy. I got only positive vibes there. At last Har Mahadev 🙏🙏
It's a mere crossroad nothing else. It's not a tourist place at all. Yes the Bhawarnath Temple is there. That's a good place with amazing vibe.

You can get buses or taxis for commuting to Lucknow, Balia and some other places too from Bhawarnath Chauraha. There are a few shops for quick snacks and tea. Royal Enfield showroom is located at this place. It is near the Purvanchal Expressway.
A peaceful and historic temple of Lord Shiva. People from far places come to pray and worship. Very neat and clean ambiance.
I went there to board bus from Azamgarh to Delhi. It took around 15 minutes from bus stand to reach there using E-rikshaw

places_with_reviews.name: Pahlwan Ki Murti
places_with_reviews.address: 25X9+94P, near, Pahlawan Chowk, Harbanshpur, Azamgarh, Uttar Pradesh 276001, India

reviews.text:
Pehalwan Tiraha in Azamgarh is a bustling intersection that encapsulates the vibrant essence of the city. This dynamic crossroads serves as a pivotal hub, connecting various neighborhoods and embodying the spirited rhythm of Azamgarh's daily life. The name "Pehalwan Tiraha" itself carries a touch of local flavor, evoking a sense of strength and resilience.

The energetic atmosphere at Pehalwan Tiraha is infectious, with a diverse array of shops, eateries, and market stalls lining the streets. From traditional local delicacies to modern conveniences, the area caters to a wide range of tastes and preferences, creating a melting pot of cultural experiences. The sights and sounds of daily life, coupled with the friendly interactions among locals, provide a genuine glimpse into the heart of Azamgarh.

Navigating through Pehalwan Tiraha reveals a tapestry of daily activities, where vendors display their wares and shoppers engage in lively bargaining. The intersection is not just a geographical point; it is a communal space where the pulse of Azamgarh is palpable.

While Pehalwan Tiraha may not boast grand architectural wonders, its significance lies in its role as a dynamic crossroads that mirrors the spirit and resilience of Azamgarh's residents. It is a place where tradition and modernity converge, making it a noteworthy and integral part of the city's cultural fabric.

places_with_reviews.name: Azamgarh Fort
places_with_reviews.address: Lakdi Ki Taal, Badarka, Azamgarh, Uttar Pradesh 276001, India

reviews.text:
It's ruined place of Mosque, shrine and Tomb of Azam Shan and their relatives and some locals which is now been demolished by locals time to time. I don't know why ASI didn't get attention anyway. The history of Azamgarh is very interesting. Here are a lot of ancient structures spread over the city.
The district is named after its headquarters town, Azamgarh, which was founded in 1665 by Azam, son of Vikramajit. Vikramajit a descendant of Gautam Rajputs of Mehnagar in pargana Nizamabad, like some of his predecessors, had embraced the faith of Islam. He had a Muhammadan wife who bore him two sons Azam and Azmat. While Azam gave his name to the town of Azamgarh, and the fort, Azmat constructed the fort and settled the bazar of Azmatgarh in pargana Sagri
Again a misleading story, it’s not a forte, it’s part of Karbala maidan with graves, it’s in much bad condition. As local around it not taking care of it.
This Is Not Fort . Don't Visit There , If you're thinking this is fort .
Good work
Ancient and better engineering of that time

reviews.text:
It's a small but famous mosque situated at the corner of the street of Bazbahadur Mohalla and way to Gulami ka pura.

At a time a total of around 150/- people can pray here in the groud and first floor, here you can perform salah of 5 times and June as well.

It's easy to reach via Kote mohalla and Harra ki chingi from opposite direction.
